views

Interface View

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.Observer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TextView

    public interface View
extends java.util.Observer
    This is the general view interface. It should be noted that this interface tends a bit towards being text-based. This is probably due to the way the Client and protocol have been set-up. It should, however, allow a GUI to connect as well.
    Author:
    Jonathan Juursema & Peter Wessels

    • Method Detail

      • askForHost

        java.net.InetAddress askForHost()
        Should ask the user for the hostname to which the client is to connect.
        Returns:
        An InetAddress object to which the client can connect.

      • askForPort

        int askForPort()
        Should ask the user for the port to which the client is to connect.
        Returns:
        A port number for the client to connect to.

      • sendNotification

        void sendNotification(java.lang.String message)
        Sends a single-string notification to the user.
        Parameters:
        message - The notification.

      • sendNotification

        void sendNotification(java.lang.String type,
                      java.lang.String message)
        Similar to Util.log and sendNotifciation.
        Parameters:
        type - Message type.
        message - Message.

      • requestNickname

        java.lang.String requestNickname()
        Request the user nickname.
        Returns:
        The user nickname.

      • askForPlayerType

        java.lang.String askForPlayerType()
        Asks the user for the player type when starting a game. Should return 'human' if the user wishes to play itself, or 'computer' when they want the AI to play for them.
        Returns:
        Either 'computer' or 'human'.

      • sendLeaderboard

        void sendLeaderboard(java.lang.String[] args)
        Updates the view with the current leaderboard. Contains a list of strings, where each string contains the player name and score, seperated by DELIMITER2.
        Parameters:
        args - The formatted strings.

      • startGame

        void startGame()
        Indicates the view that the game has started.

      • showChat

        void showChat(java.lang.String message)
        Sends a chat message to the view.
        Parameters:
        message - The formatted chat message.

      • connected

        void connected()
        Notifies the view that the cient is connected.

      • giveTurn

        void giveTurn()
        Notifies the view that it is the user's turn.

      • showTurn

        void showTurn()
        Instructs the view to show the user the current turn.

      • showBoard

        void showBoard()
        Instructs the view to show the user the current board.

      • showHand

        void showHand()
        Instructs the view to show the user the current hand.

      • gotInvite

        void gotInvite(java.lang.String string)
        Instructs the view to notify the user that they have a pending invite.
        Parameters:
        string - The name of the inviting player.

      • sendScores

        void sendScores(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> scores)
        Updates the view with the scores of the current game.
        Parameters:
        scores - A hashmap of Strings to Integers which maps player names to their scores.

      • stop

        void stop(java.lang.String message)
        Instructs the view that the client is to be closed.
        Parameters:
        message - A message for the user.
